newsitem.title: JORDAN: Israeli president arrives in Jordan.
newsitem.headline: Israeli president arrives in Jordan.

text.p: Israeli President Ezer Weizman arrived in Amman on Wednesday for talks with Jordan's King Hussein, witnesses said.

They said Weizman, making his first visit to Jordan, landed by helicopter in the grounds of the royal palace in Amman, where he was met by the king, Crown Prince Hassan, and Prime Minister Abdul-Karim al-Kabariti.
Weizman's visit is aimed at patching up relations between the two neighbouring countries, which signed a 1994 peace treaty ending a 46-year state of war.

Israel angered Jordan in September when it opened a tunnel near Moslem holy sites in Jerusalem without consulting King Hussein, whose "special role" in supervising the sites was recognised in the 1994 accord.

King Hussein, seen as Israel's closest Arab peace partner, warned of a return to violence in the Middle East if Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reneged on agreements signed by previous governments.
